results.title: La Spagnola
results.creator_credit: Steve Jacobs, Anna-Maria Monticelli, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent and Wild Strawberries
results.brief_description: Directed by Steve Jacobs and set in 1960, “La Spagnola” is one family’s story of the migrant experience in Australia. Lola (Lola Marceli) is a beautiful, tempestuous Spanish woman living in a remote industrial town with her boorish husband, Ricardo (Simon Palomares), and their teenage daughter, Lucia (Alice Ansara). When Ricardo decides to leave her for his Australian mistress, Lola is left destitute and pregnant turns violent and vengeful. Her daughter, sensitive, lonely, mocked at school, and confused by her mother’s anger toward her, seeks refuge in an aunt and tries to reconcile with her absent father. Lola is driven by a quest for revenge against the two who have robbed her of her only security in a strange land. Lola and Lucia, each striking out hatefully at the other, are on a collision course, plotting their separate plans for vengeance. Also starring Alex Dimitriades as a local playboy, romantically interested in both mother and daughter. Mostly in Spanish, with Italian and English, and with English subtitles.

results.title: Honeymoon in Vegas (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Bergman, Mike Lobell, Castle Rock Entertainment and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Nicholas Cage is Jack Singer, a second-rate private eye who has somehow managed to win the undying love of gorgeous school teacher, Betsy Nolan (Sarah Jessica Parker). Now, after 5 years Betsy wants a commitment, but Jack is plagued by his mother’s deathbed wish that he never marry. In an irrational moment Jack relents and they travel to Vegas to exchange their vows, and this is where the trouble begins. Featuring James Caan as a wealthy, evil card-shark and a cast including several-hundred Elvis impersonators, it’s a hunka hunka burnin’ fun!

results.title: Nasty love = L'Amore molesto
results.creator_credit: Mario Martone, Andrea Occhipinti, Angelo Curti, Kermit Smith, Lucky Red and Teatri Uniti
results.brief_description: A woman goes to investigate her mother’s apparent suicide and ends up having to face the grim reality of her past. Amalia, the sixty-something mother of Delia, is found dead on the beach, when she should have been on her way to visit Delia in Bologna. Delia, wanting to know why her mother killed herself, journeys back to Naples to discover the truth. She encounters her mother’s supposed lover and his son, as well as her estranged father. As she continues to explore, she must face the fact that her relationship with her mother was based on jealousy and disgust as much as it was on love. She must also face up to a terrible lie she told as a child, one that questioned her mother’s fidelity and ruined the lives of everyone around her. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes Anna Bonaiuto, Angela Luce, Gianni Cajafa and Giovanni Viglietti.

results.title: Hilary and Jackie
results.creator_credit: Anand Tucker, Andy Paterson, Nicolas Kent and Oxford Film Company
results.brief_description: This is the story of two gifted sisters who grew up in England in the 1950s and competed for musical accolade and love. Hilary was a talented flautist, but it was her sister, Jackie, who was the musical genius who went on to become one of the greatest cellists of the 20th century, while Hilary chose a simple family life in the country. The film follows their sibling rivalry in musical competition and romance, and in spite of their differences they both share common emotions, including jealousy. As Jackie struggles with her rapid rise to fame, her journey would have incredible and devastating consequences on both hers and Hilary’s lives. Cast includes Emily Watson, Rachel Griffiths, James Frain and David Morrissey.

results.title: Forever, Lulu
results.creator_credit: Amos Kollek, Lulu Productions and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: In this comedy in the vein of “Desperately seeking Susan” a young German woman (Hanna Schygulla), struggling to survive in New York City, dreams of becoming a novelist. One day, broke, lonely and on the street she stumbles across a photograph of a beautiful blond named Lulu (Debbie Harry) and decides to track her down. Instantly, both her luck and her life take a dramatic new direction. Her madcap quest leads her into a real-life gangster mystery involving drugs and murder that just might bring her the fame and fortune she craves.

results.title: The Quick and the dead
results.creator_credit: Sam Raimi, Allen Shapiro, Joshua Donin, Patrick Markey and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Ellen (Sharon Stone), a female gunslinger, arrives in the town of Redemption for a quick-draw contest. The contest has been the initiative of the town’s corrupt mayor, Herod (Gene Hackman), and attracts gunslingers from around the county, all with mysterious pasts. Ellen is seeking revenge on Herod for past injustices, the smooth talker known as ‘The Kid’ (Leonardo DiCaprio) may possibly be the mayor’s son, and the quiet Reverend Cort (Russell Crowe) refuses to participate despite being the fastest gun in town. As the contest continues all is revealed, leading to a final showdown between Ellen and Herod.

results.title: The Pedlar
results.creator_credit: Allan Kroeker, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Pedlar is a dramatic film based on the short story by W.D. Valgardson, A Place of One’s Own. Tired of the rootless, lonely existence of a travelling merchant, a man searches for a place to settle down, and someone to share his life. Stars Lubomir Mykytiuk, Thomas Peacocke, Doreen Brownstown and Marilyn Magnusson.

results.title: Get out your handkerchiefs = Preparez vos mouchoirs
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Blier, Alexande Minouchkine, George Dancigers, Paul Claudon and Interama
results.brief_description: Gerard Depardieu is Raoul, a young working-class man devoted to his wife, Solange, played by Carole Laure. Convinced that Solange has tired of him, he convinces a stranger, Stephan (Patrick Dewaere), to enter a menage-a-trois with himself and Solange. However, no matter how hard they try, no matter how much love they offer Solange, they are unable to bring a smile to her face or make her fall pregnant (which they believe is all that she really needs). A trip away to a summer camp leads to Solange meeting the precocious Christian, a thirteen year old boy with the IQ of a genius. At first, she attempts to mother the boy, but finds herself slowly seduced by him, and Stephan and Raoul can only stand-by and watch as the teenager gives Solange everything they cannot. This wickedly sly comedy about marriage, sexual mores, and the differences between men and women won the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language film in 1978. Though definitely absurdist in its sensibility, “Get Out Your Handkerchiefs” refuses to treat its characters cynically or cruelly. Rather, it is as if in examining the fall-out of the sexual revolution, Blier’s response is to throw up his arms, laugh at the madness of it all, and finally to celebrate the madness of the battle of the sexes. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Jimmy Neutron: boy genius
results.creator_credit: Albie Hecht, Steve Oedekerk, John A. Davis, Nickelodeon Movies, O Entertainment and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Computer animated sci-fi story about boy genius Jimmy Neutron who unwittingly causes havoc when a satellite launched by him is picked up by an alien species known as Yokians. These strange green aliens invade Jimmy’s hometown Retroville in the dark of night and abduct all the parents in the town leaving it up to Jimmy, along with his robotic dog, Goddard, his best friend Carl Wheezer and his arch rival Cindy Vortex to take to the skies in a rescue bid to save the parents from becoming human sacrifices. Features the voices of Debi Derryberry, Megan Cavanagh, Mark Decarlo, Martin Short and Patrick Stewart.
